posts.name: Yahya Burak
posts.cooked: İ just flashed the roborio V1 to 2025.1.1 however in wpilib build gradle version is 2025.2.1 and when it comes to deploy code,it always giving error.How can i find the 2025.2.1 image for roborio ör download the 2025.1.1 version of wpilib?

posts.name: Tamer
posts.cooked: Try updating your NI Game tools from NI Package Manager. The latest version should appear in the RIO imaging tool.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
There is no roboRIO image 2025.2.1. Can you post the complete error message?

If you had previously installed the beta game tools, as stated at the link below, it’s necessary to uninstall before installing the released game tools. Installing the FRC Game Tools — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

link_counts.title: Installing the FRC Game Tools — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Jeremy Chaney
posts.cooked:
Not sure if this is the same error as what they’re seeing but it’s at least on the same track…

The error message is: Invalid RoboRIO Image Version! Current image version: 2025_v1.1 GradleRIO-compatible image versions: 2025_v2.*

The code we have does build successfully, this error only happens at the deploy stage.

It appears the latest version of WPILib sets the version to 2025.2.1 in the gradle.build file. From what I can tell, the 2025 AprilTag class is tied to this update because the 2025.1.1 WPI class only has 2022, 2023 and 2024.

We’ve tried updating the NI Game tools and can’t find the 2025_v2 image anywhere.

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
The 2025_v1.1 image is from the beta game tools.

JChaney:

We’ve tried updating the NI Game tools and can’t find the 2025_v2 image anywhere.

Did you follow the directions linked above to uninstall beta versions?

posts.name: Jeremy Chaney
posts.cooked: yes, as a sanity check we just re-did those instructions but we still can’t find the 2025_v2 images anywhere.

posts.name: Yahya Burak
posts.cooked: yes ı cant flash roborıo v2.1 so ı download the wpilib v1.1 so roborio and wpilib versions are v1.1

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: What version did you find? Or do you not know where to look?

posts.name: Yahya Burak
posts.cooked: I found wpilib version of 2025.1.1 on github beta release.İt matches with roborio’s flashed version,so there is not any issue

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked: I’m not sure there isn’t a issue. Are you in compliance with R701 ?

posts.name: Jeremy Chaney
posts.cooked:
We got the code building and deploying at the end of the workday today but it was not obvious or really practical… I don’t know for sure that uninstalling the old NI versions was part of the solution, for all I know we had it the whole time because when we did find the 2025_v2 image, it was under a path behind “LabVIEW 2023” ( “C:\Program Files (x86)\National Instruments\LabVIEW 2023\project\roboRIO Tool\ FRC Images\SD Images” to be exact).

Anyways after using this new image for the RoboRIO, and using the RoboRIO Imaging tool to set a team number, we were able to deploy our code from gradle version 2025.2.1.

Hope this helps!
